{{Description|The Mondstadt bard Lenne is discussing poetry quite passionately with the Inazuman poet Ootomo...}}
'''The Moon and Stars Inscribe''' is a part of the [[Hues of the Violet Garden]] [[Event]] in [[Version 2.6]].

==Event Details==
===Duration===
* 2022-04-07 10:00 - 2022-04-25 03:59

===Requirements===
* Complete the "True Tales of the Violet Garden: Act I" quest in the "Legends of the Kasen."

===Summary===
* According to the poets [[Lenne]] and [[Ootomo]], you can take pictures in specific regions after receiving daily themes to obtain inspiration.
* After collecting a certain number of inspirational materials, you can complete the theme creation and obtain Primogems, Talent Level-Up Materials, Hero's Wit, and more.

==Tutorial==
{{Tutorial
|image1  = Tutorial The Moon and Stars Inscribe 1.png
|text1   = According to the poets Lenne and Ootomo, you can take pictures in specific regions after receiving daily themes to obtain inspiration.
|image2  = Tutorial The Moon and Stars Inscribe 2.png
|text2   = The more material you obtain, the better you can help the poets Lenne and Ootomo figure out more poetic stanzas, thus helping them to complete their poems faster.
}}

==Poems==
===Theme 1: Nostalgia===
{{Main|Irodori Poetry: Part I}}
{{Description|Upon seeing the sights in a distant land, a vagabond cannot help but remember their home. It would be nice to depict some things that symbolize this distant place...<br />Take pictures of {{Color|Pyro|Inazuma regional specialties}} to get key inspiration material.}}
{{Card|Primogem|40}}{{Card|Mora|20,000}}{{Card|Hero's Wit|2}}{{Card|Philosophies of Transience|2}}
{|class="article-table" style="text-align:center;"
! style="width:16rem;" | Poem Text !! style="width:16rem;" | Missing Stanza Option !! Object required
|-
| rowspan="5" | '''Gains and Losses'''<br />
The day I took my leave of loving<br />
I found I loved all things again<br />
When tired at last of seeking and striving<br />
I heard again freedom's refrain<br />
{{Color|Pyro|missing stanza}}<br />
Then suddenly, I saw<br />
T'was the unseen breeze<br />
That helped push me from home shores.
| The radiant flowers abroad do bloom<br />Their scent a novel, lovely strain || [[Sakura Bloom]] or [[Dendrobium]]
|-
| In the woods lies armor of a violet hue,<br />'Tis the unspoken blessing from a foreign god || [[Onikabuto]]
|-
| Of distant lands' joys my heart was dissuaded<br />Naught but the slim grass' song remained || [[Naku Weed]] or [[Amakumo Fruit]]
|-
| The Lamp Grass under distant skies gleaming<br />To mind the nights abroad did feign || [[Sea Ganoderma]] or [[Fluorescent Fungus]]
|-
| O Time! You make ancient laments wither<br />Yet let dazzling pearls remain || [[Sango Pearl]] or [[Crystal Marrow]]
|}

===Theme 2: Friendship===
{{Main|Irodori Poetry: Part II}}
{{Description|Lamenting that they did not meet sooner, the two poets would like to depict animals wandering the landscape in companionship and compare their friendship to such scenes...<br />Take pictures of {{Color|Pyro|animals found in Inazuma}} to get key inspiration material.}}
{{Card|Primogem|40}}{{Card|Mora|20,000}}{{Card|Hero's Wit|2}}{{Card|Philosophies of Elegance|2}}
{|class="article-table" style="text-align:center;"
! style="width:18rem;" | Poem Text !! style="width:18rem;" | Missing Stanza Option !! Animal required
|-
| rowspan="5" | '''Ode to Friendship'''<br />
A new friend, yet as if from old days<br />
How I wish our story could have begun there<br />
{{Color|Pyro|missing stanza}}<br />
Stars shine upon our meeting, the sky embellished with pearls twinkling<br />
From the joy of union we are awakening, our sleeves inlaid with moonlit dews shimmering
| Imagine our childish rambling, far and wild our paths crawling || [[General Crab]], [[Pale Red Crab]], [[Marrow Lizard]], [[Sunset Loach]], or [[Sunny Loach]]
|-
| Imagine all the nights of tale-telling, their mystery enchanting || [[Kitsune]], [[Bake-Danuki]], or [[Gray Snow Cat]]
|-
| Imagine all our wild dreaming, to borrow the wind in sunny days like birds flying || [[Violet Ibis]], [[Crow]], or [[Electro Crystalfly]]
|-
| Imagine all the lakes and seas we could have gone roaming || [[Adorned Unagi]], [[Red-Finned Unagi]], [[Raimei Angelfish]], [[Purple Shirakodai]], [[Glaze Medaka]], or [[Lunged Stickleback]]
|}

===Theme 3: Parting?===
{{Main|Irodori Poetry: Part III}}
{{Description|All feasts must someday end. The two poets decide to correspond via letters in the future. As a parting gift, they want to pour all their heart and soul into this poem... Take pictures of {{Color|Pyro|Mondstadt's regional specialties}} to get key inspiration material.}}
{{Card|Primogem|40}}{{Card|Mora|20,000}}{{Card|Hero's Wit|2}}{{Card|Philosophies of Light|2}}
{|class="article-table" style="text-align:center;"
! style="width:16rem;" | Poem Text !! style="width:16rem;" | Missing Stanza Option !! Object required
|-
| rowspan="5" | '''Farewell, Mountain Sakura'''<br />
So my friend, cast your glance upon the sakura once more<br />
'Tis the first sip of a sweet sake<br />
Savor its eternal tenderness that renders you in awe<br />
So my friend, cast your glance upon the sakura once more<br />
{{Color|Pyro|missing stanza}}<br />
So my friend, cast your glance upon the sakura once more<br />
'Tis a newly written ballad on your lips<br />
Bury it in your heart<br />
Hang it high amidst the starry night
| 'Tis the first bite on a wild berry<br />O the sourness of curiosity you will never forget || [[Wolfhook]] or [[Valberry]]
|-
| 'Tis the first stride in search of the wind<br />On an unknown path a journey unfolds || [[Dandelion Seed]], [[Windwheel Aster]], or [[Philanemo Mushroom]]
|-
| 'Tis a freshly picked flower, its shape round and plump<br />Like a throbbing heart when seeing a maiden of love || [[Small Lamp Grass]] or [[Calla Lily]]
|-
| 'Tis the steep cliff climbed in youth<br />A lonely silhouette lingering in the dream || [[Cecilia]]
|}
